person.persName: Richard T. Petree (Hopkinsville, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Hopkinsville, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Todd County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hazel G. Petree, Sr. and Sarah M. Petree. Married to Mary W. Hubbard Petree in 1854. Father of Betty H. Petree, Mary D. Petree, and Newton C. Petree. Educated at an academy in Elkton, Kentucky. Studied law under Francis M. Bristow. Admitted to the bar in 1848. Relocated to Hopkinsville. County attorney for Christian County from 1851 to 1859. Law partner of Francis M. Bristow in Hopkinsville. Law Partner of Benjamin H. Bristow in Hopkinsville from 1857 to 1861. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Judge of the 2nd Judicial District of Kentucky from 1862 to 1868.
